alert.note: Alert for Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Grant, central Garland, Saline, northeastern Hot Spring and central Pulaski Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hot Springs Village to near Traskwood to near East End. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Hot Springs... Benton... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Hot Springs Village... Malvern... Southwest Little Rock... Haskell... Shannon Hills... Mountain Pine... Rockport... Traskwood... Tull... Prattsville... Poyen... Perla... Lonsdale... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 91 and 133. Interstate 40 near mile marker 143. Interstate 430 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 630 between mile markers 5 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Pulaski; Saline
